title: League won't open after clicking "launch"
body:
So I hop on to my computer because I want to play some league, next thing you know after clicking "Launch" nothing pops up. I try again thinking this is just a little issue that my be resolved by restarting the patcher. Nope, nothing pops up again. i check my task manager and its running, but its running in the background. I look up some solutions like:

- Restarting My Computer
- Uninstalling and Reinstalling
- Deleting the latest patch and downloading it again
- Clicking LoLClient.exe from its file location after clicking "Launch" from the patcher
- Running league as an administrator
- Turning off firewall

I tried all these given solutions but none worked. Help is appreciated, thanks!

replies.body:
yow i saw your post as i try to find solution to the same problem and again i see targons blade's useless comment so i decided to do it myself so i it's not fixed for you yet this is how i did it.
go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends, find the file name "leagueclient" and delete it. i don't know if you have to run it as administrator first but i found lol.launcher.admin and double clicked that and it works.

When League doesn't launch after patching, it can be due to the client not being able to establish a stable connection to the login servers. As a first step, I recommend working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to see if your local network settings are conflicting with League. 

Let me know if you notice any change after working through those steps.
